page.title: 08EDUCATION AND LIBRARIES
page.content: {Schools}- The area is served by {Hogarth Primary,}recently amalgamated from a separate infant and junior school (the infant building is currently used for youth training). Despite local opposition,{Hutton {village C.P.}will close in July '85. St. Martins Comprehensive serves a large part of Hutton (roll 1100), while other children go to a number of secondary schools just outside the area.{Brentwood School}(Public) is just outside the area, but most of the extensive playing fields and Preparatory school are within. { Shenfield Library}has all the usual facilities as well as providing "extras" such as large print books. A Talking Newspaper provides 150 weekly cassetes, 300 monthly and 600 quarterly. A{Brentwood Advertiser}in Braille is available.
